text: so you've got your Thanksgiving turkey
step 1
unwrap it first you need to make sure
that it's not frozen a frozen turkey
takes 24 hours for every 5 pounds 15
pound bird 3 days in your fridge
this guy's fresh never been frozen step
2 you want to cut the opening right here
important do this over the sink a
torrent of liquid is going to come out
it's nasty you don't want on your
counter you don't need to rinse any
bacteria on the turkey is gonna get
blasted off in the oven if your turkey
happens to have a little plastic thing a
m'jiggyyyy like this you just want to
cut it off because you need to get into
the cavity take out the neck no neck I
roast my neck along with the turkey and
then the giblets are usually hiding here
behind the neck flap take out your
giblets I'm gonna save these for stuff
cut this neck flap off save this you can
put it on top of your stuffing if you
bake it outside the bird adds tons of
flavor and drippings you see this little
pop-up thing this is supposed to tell
you when your turkeys done it's gonna
tell you when your turkey is overdone
take it out don't listen to it don't eat
it next step just dry them off with
paper towels inside and outside through
the paper towels away as soon as you do
it under his arms my little guy you want
them to be dry so that when you put all
the seasonings on they don't fall right
off and that's it
